# Output generated by @ua_chatgpt_bot

Ваше питання: Create a presentation about Emanuel Macron

Відповідь: Macron: A Profile

Emanuel Macron is an influential French politician and the 25th President of France since his election in 2017. His rise to power has been incredibly swift and unexpected by many. 

Background: Born in Amiens, France in 1977, Macron was the only child of two physicians. He attended high school at the Lycée Henri-IV, and began his studies at Science Po and the National School of Administration. He graduated from the latter with a Master’s degree in Public Affairs.

Career: After his graduation, Macron worked as an inspector of finances in the French Ministry of Economy and Finance. He later joined Rothschild & Cie Banque and became a highly successful banker in 2008. He left the banking world to begin a career in politics in 2012. The following year he became the Deputy Secretary General of the ÉlysÉE and was the youngest person to ever hold the position. 

In 2016 Macron founded En Marche!, an independent political movement, and shortly after announced his candidacy for the 2017 presidential election. During his campaign, he pursued a center-left platform with a focus on economic reforms and European reformism. He took a strong stance against climate change and nuclear weapons, while advocating for the phasing out of nuclear energy. In the first round of presidential voting, 22 candidates competed, but the final two were Macron and Marine Le Pen. Ultimately, Macron achieved victory against Le Pen, winning 66.1% of the vote. 

Presidency: During his presidency, Macron has set out to reform the French government and make France more competitive. He has made significant cuts in public spending without raising taxes, introduced labour reforms and loosened regulations on business. He is making strides for equality in the workplace, with plans for equal pay for men and women and extending parental leave. He is also pushing for greater integration in Europe, having formed the Paris Forum for Peace and Security in 2019. Macron has been an advocate for democracy, human rights and the rule of law. His government has supported the withdrawal of troops from African countries that have experienced long-term civil wars and advocated for an international ban on the use of chemical weapons. 

Conclusion: Emanuel Macron has been an influential figure in French politics since he began his time as President of France in 2017. He is pushing for economic, social and environmental reform to make France more competitive and create a better future for its citizens. He is staunchly pro-European, promoting greater integration and a stronger sense of unity. Macron also places an emphasis on international law and human rights, and has been active in working towards peace and stability.
